title: Can't deploy a tenant
content:
When the system cannot deploy a tenant, check the operation history in Suite Administration.

In the operation history, you may find the following error message: Failed error messages: The operation of IDOLDriver timed out before the condition was fulfilled.

Cause

The failure of the tenant deployment is caused by the incorrect status of the Smart Analytics pods.

Solution

Check the status of the related Smart Analytics pods and restart the ones that aren't in the correct status.

To do this, follow these steps:

  1. On the suite control plane node, run the following command to check the status of the Smart Analytics pods:

    kubectl get pods -n <suite-namespace>|grep 'smarta-saw'
  2. If you see any pods are in an incorrect status such as "pod not running" or "container not ready", stop the corresponding Smart Analytics pod.
  3. Delete the corresponding data folder of the failed Smart Analytics pod. For example, for smarta-saw-con-1, delete the <smart analytics volume>/data/idol/saw/content1 folder. Or, if a local storage is configured, clean the corresponding local data folder.
  4. Start the Smart Analytics pod.
  5. Perform re-indexing for Smart Analytics.
  6. Create and deploy the tenant again to see if the tenant can be successfully deployed.
